data.title: Legendary rock star doesn’t think he’ll get into Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Here’s why.
authors: Saleah Blancaflor | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
data.meta_description: The icon recently shared his thoughts about his nomination with Rolling Stone.
data.text:
Ozzy Osbourne is up for a Rock and Roll Hall of Fame nomination as a solo artist, but the heavy metal luminary recently revealed that he isn’t sure he’ll even receive it.

During a recent interview with Rolling Stone, Osbourne — who was previously inducted as a member of Black Sabbath — said the nomination has been “driving (him) mad.”

“It’s an honor that I’m nominated, but I’m not expecting to get in,” Osbourne, 75, told Rolling Stone. “There’s Mariah Carey, there’s Cher, Lenny Kravitz. I’m up against some serious people. If I get in, I get in. If I don’t, I don’t.”

In the past, Osbourne criticized the Rock Hall, slamming it as an institution of the “supposed elite for the industry” though he had a change of heart after Black Sabbath was inducted in 2006.

Winners who get inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame typically perform on stage with a few songs and asked whether he’ll perform, the Prince of Darkness said it’s a “maybe.”

Osbourne has suffered from health issues in recent years including a Parkinson’s disease diagnosis in 2020 and was forced to retire from touring. Last year, he cancelled his European tour dates due to a spinal injury.

“I would love to, but I can’t stand up right,” Osbourne told the music publication. “Maybe I’ll do something one day. I miss it terribly.”

Rock & Roll Hall of Fame winners will be announced in late April.
